View

View functionality.  Views are templates that are rendered to a browser.

Functions

set

public static function set($key,  
$value =  null)

Sets key value pairs.

Parameters

$keyKey, eg.  ‘title’.
$valueValue of key, eg.  ‘web.dot.php’.  Defaults to null.

get

public static function get($key =  null)

Gets the value for key.

Parameters

$keyKey of the value we’re getting, defaults to null.

Returns

Associated value for key or null.

has

public static function has($key)

Checks wheter a key has a value.

Parameters

$keyKey we’re trying to check.

Returns

true or false.

render

public static function render($view =  null,
$data =  null,
$layout =  null)

Renders the view.

Parameters

$viewPath to the view file to be rendered, eg.  (views/filename.php), defaults to null.
$dataData to be passed to the actual view.  Type Array, eg. array(‘key’ => ‘value’), defaults to null.
$layoutPath to the layout file that wraps the view (if wanted).  Defaults to null.
web-dot-php.googlecode.com.  Generated by Natural Docs.
